page.title: 07CRAB WOOD,SPARSHOLT.
page.content: Crab Wood is in two parts.The east side is a nature reserve of special scientific interest because rare animals such as the Doormouse, White Letter Hairstreak Butterfly and Nightingale live and breed. This woodland dates back to the 16th century,it is called Crab Wood because crab apple trees grow there. There are also very old beech,oak,ash, sycamore and yew trees.The tallest tree is about thirty meters high. Crab Wood was privately owned,but now it is looked after by the local council,for public use.As Crab Wood is a nature reserve people are not allowed to take the animals or pick the flowers,however poachers have been caught poaching deer,rabbit and pheasant.
